objects.name: The timestamp of notification should be changed after 3 minute without any actions

steps.expected: There should a "just now" in the right hand side of this notification

steps.expected: The screen is closed
steps.instruction: Tap the "Power" button to close the screen.

steps.expected: The "just now" should be changed to "3m ago"
steps.instruction: Wait for 3 minutes and open the device again
Go to Settings > Screen Lock > enable "Passcode lock"

steps.expected:
1. The passcode should be input first.
2. The timestamp should be changed accordingly.

objects.description:
Verify that the STK menu and its sub-menu display all expected items properly.

Please see this issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1046564

* Turn RIL debug flag on
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Tips\_And\_Tricks#RIL_Debugging
* Testing of STK\_CMD\_SELECT\_ITEM = 0x24 in this case

* adb logcat -v threadtime | grep typeOfCommand
* 0x24(hex) & 36(dec) can be found in adb logcat
objects.name: Sim Toolkit menu and its sub-menu display all expected items properly - STK_CMD_SELECT_ITEM = 0x24

steps.instruction: Insert an STK-enabled SIM to DUT.

steps.expected:
The menu and the sub-menu display contents properly.

* adb logcat -v threadtime | grep typeOfCommand
* 0x24(hex) & 36(dec) can be found in adb logcat

objects.description:
This test verifies the SEND SMS Command

PREREQUISITES:
-----
* Turn RIL debug flag on
* https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/Tips\_And\_Tricks#RIL_Debugging
* Testing of STK\_CMD\_SEND\_SM = 0x13 in this case

* adb logcat -v threadtime | grep typeOfCommand
* 0x13(hex) or 19(dec) can be found in adb logcat
objects.name: SEND SMS Command - STK_CMD_SEND_SMS = 0x13

steps.expected:
SMS received.

* adb logcat -v threadtime | grep typeOfCommand
* 0x13(hex) or 19(dec) can be found in adb logcat
steps.instruction:

* e.g. Chungwa sim (466:92) -> emome加值 -> 行動字典 -> any of them

objects.description: Please refer https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/PingTesting#AppUsage_Ping to 1. Setup server in google app engine 2. Flash a customized gaia
objects.name: Usage Time - Time is attributed to callscreen when taking incoming call

steps.instruction: Open the clock app and wait for 10 sec.

steps.expected: The incoming call screen should show up.
steps.instruction: Make a phone call to the device under test from another phone, do not answer it.

steps.expected: The call screen is dismissed and it goes back to the clock app.
steps.instruction: Wait for 10 seconds and hand up the call.

steps.expected: Goes back to the home screen.
The information should be sent to server
steps.instruction: Wait for the seconds you set for AUM.REPORTINTERVAL in apps/system/js/appusage_metrics.js and check the metrics server

steps.expected: A list of logs will be shown in right hand side
steps.instruction: Go to metric server In left hand side, click Main > Logs

steps.expected: The usageTime for clock.gaiamobile.org should be ~10 sec. The usage time for callscreen.gaiamobile.org should be ~10 sec. The rest of the usage time should be attributed to verticalhome.gaiamobile.org.

objects.description: Please refer https://wiki.mozilla.org/B2G/QA/PingTesting#AppUsage_Ping to 1. Setup server in google app engine 2. Flash a customized gaia. (Notice: phone under test must have proximity sensor)
objects.name: Usage Time - Proximity sensor active when taking incoming call

steps.instruction: Open the clock app and wait for 10 sec.

steps.expected: Switched to the phone call screen.
steps.instruction: Make a phone call to the device under test from another phone, answer it.

steps.expected: The screen turns black.
steps.instruction: Cover the front side of the phone to simulate the face activating the proximity sensor, wait for 10 sec.
Remove the cover, and end the call immediately

steps.expected: Goes back to the home screen.
The information should be sent to server
steps.instruction: Wait for the seconds you set for AUM.REPORTINTERVAL in apps/system/js/appusage_metrics.js and check the metrics server

steps.expected: A list of logs will be shown in right hand side
steps.instruction: Go to metric server In left hand side, click Main > Logs

steps.expected: The usageTime for clock.gaiamobile.org should be ~10 sec. The usage time for callscreen.gaiamobile.org should be ~10 sec. The rest of the usage time should be attributed to verticalhome.gaiamobile.org.

steps.expected: A list of logs will be shown in right hand side
steps.instruction: Go to metric server In left hand side, click Main > Logs

steps.expected: The usageTime for settings.gaiamobile.org should match the actual time you spent on the settings app. It should not be very large (~1 day)

steps.instruction: Wait for the seconds you set for AUM.REPORTINTERVAL in apps/system/js/appusage_metrics.js and check the metrics server

steps.expected: A list of logs will be shown in right hand side
steps.instruction: Go to metric server In left hand side, click Main > Logs

steps.expected: The usageTime for settings.gaiamobile.org should match the actual time you spent on the settings app.

objects.description:
Preconditions:
* global location accuracy is enabled
* global location accuracy is set to "Custom Location"
objects.name: Change in global location accuracy settings does not affect location accuracy settings for applications

steps.expected: Verify that each application reports location according to set location accuracy
steps.instruction:
Set location accuracy for 5 applications this way:
* 1st has location accuracy set as "Global settings"
* 2nd has location accuracy set as "Adjust Location Accuracy"
* 3rd has location accuracy set as "Custom Location"
* 4th has location accuracy set as "Precise"
* 5th has location accuracy set as "No Location"

steps.expected:
Verify that on each change:
* each application reports location according to set location accuracy
* the 1st application always reports location according global accuracy settings
steps.instruction:
Change global accuracy this way one by one: 
* change custom location in global location accuracy settings
* set it to "Adjust Location Accuracy"
* set it to "Precise"
* set it to "No Location"

objects.description:

Verify that:
* location information is present in picture metadata
* location information corresponds to the coordinates where picture was taken

steps.expected:
Verify that:
* camera application still functions smoothly - it is fully responsive and you are able to take pictures
* location information is not present in picture metadata
steps.instruction: Take a picture with camera application
Enter a place where your  GPS position is determined

steps.expected:

* location information is present in picture metadata

objects.description:
This test is to verify that settings for ALA feature are persisted and reapply correctly after phone is recovered.

Preconditions:
* global location accuracy is enabled
* global location accuracy is set to "Custom Location"
* data transfer is enabled to spped up process of acquiring of current geolocation with A-GPS
objects.name: ALA settings are permanently stored

steps.expected: Verify that each application reports location according to set location accuracy
steps.instruction:
Set location accuracy for 5 applications this way:
* 1st app has location accuracy set as "Global settings"
* 2nd app has location accuracy set as "Adjust Location Accuracy"
* 3rd app has location accuracy set as "Custom Location"
* 4th app has location accuracy set as "Precise"
* 5th app has location accuracy set as "No Location"

steps.expected:
Verify that each time the phone is switched on and GPS location is known:
* each application reports location according to set location accuracy
* the 1st application always reports location according global accuracy settings
steps.instruction:
Perform these actions to restart phone:
* restart the phone via power key menu
* switch the phone off and then on
* take out the battery, insert it back and switch the phone on

objects.description:
When time moves back or forward due to day light savings time, the time on the phone will automatically adjust to the correct time.

Prerequisite:
The Date and Time should be set to "Set automatically" in settings. The user should be using an active SIM that is connected to a network. WiFi should be turned off.

Please see this issue:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1089494
objects.name: The time is always displayed correctly after day light savings time

steps.instruction: Be in a timezone where daylight savings (Cest to Cet for Europe)  is about to take place.
Set an alarm  that will go off after the time change takes place.

steps.expected: The time automatically was set to the correct time.
steps.instruction: Once the time change takes place, observe the status bar.

steps.expected: The Timezone, Date and Time are all correct.
The alarm is triggered at the correct time.
steps.instruction: Wait for the alarm to go off.

objects.description:
*Functionality: FTE of rocketbar 
*Bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1099157
*UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/44utizl9oz4eupyu3fuu/1/2545278347

When the user begins to type on the search bar for the first time, they are presented with the Search Suggestions advisory. The user can dismiss the advisory by tapping on the close button in the advisory or deep link into the
Settings app.
objects.name: [Rocketbar] verify the FTE behavior for Rocketbar search suggestion

steps.instruction: reflash the phone to the latest build and connect the phone to Internet

steps.expected:
1. Before typing, only empty display with keyboard enabled.
2. After typing, the results are shown. Make sure "search suggestion" part has "search suggestions advisory", and it contains "device settings" which is a link.
3. Verify the displayed contents of app recommendations and search suggestions are correct.
steps.instruction: tap rocketbar on homescreen and type some input (e.g. "firefox") which input length > 3.

steps.expected: Search page of Settings is launched and shown. The default search engine is "Google". (Might be Yahoo or other search provider).
steps.instruction: press "Device Settings" shown in "search suggestions advisory"

steps.expected: back to search app
A browser is launched, and bring user to the search result page with input "firefox" (or other input typed at step 2). Verify the search result page is provided by the Search Engine shown in step3.

objects.name: [Rocketbar] verify no FTE behavior for Rocketbar search suggestion when offline

steps.instruction: reflash the phone to the latest build and do not connect the phone to Internet

steps.expected:
1. Before typing, only empty display with keyboard enabled.
2. After typing, the results are shown and have 2 sections: (A) app recommendation which only recommends local apps, and (B) search suggestion without FTE advisory and has only one item: "No internet connection".
steps.instruction: tap rocketbar on homescreen and type some input (e.g. "phone").

objects.name: [Gallery] Notification messages should be right aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Click on the Gallery app with no pictures inside

steps.expected:
3.1.Empty gallery notification message is right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one.    
3.2.The text within "Go to Camera" button should be center-aligned and read right to left.Nothing should overlap.     
3.3.The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Gallery] Image info dialog should be right aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Click on the Gallery app with a few pictures inside
Select the photo, and click the info icon bottom

steps.expected:
4.1.The header and entry of each row in the image info is right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one.   
4.2.The date should successively show as year, month, day from left to right.    
4.3.The spacing between text and right edge in RTL mode should be same as spacing between text and left edge in LTR mode.    
4.4.The name of file should not be mirrored.    
4.5.Text within close button should be center-aligned.    
4.6.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Video] Image info dialog should be right aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Click on the Video app with a few videos inside

steps.expected: Listed times should be right-aligned and read right to left, text within cancel button should be center-aligned.
steps.instruction: Select the video, selection ... button on top

steps.expected:
4.1.The header and entry of each row in the image info is right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one.   
4.2.Video file name should not be mirrored.   
4.3.The date should successively show as year, month, day from left to right.    
4.4.Text within close button should be center-aligned.    
4.5. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Click the more info buttomt and observe the notification message

objects.name: [Video] Notification messages should be right aligned in RTL      rtl

steps.instruction: Click on the Video app with no videos inside

steps.expected: Empty Video notification message is right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Video] Headers should be right aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Have videos from different months in your Video app

steps.expected: Subheaders separating the grid sections are right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the subheaders separating the grid section (where the pictures are)

objects.name: [Video] Rows are mirrored in RTL

steps.instruction: Have videos from different months in your Video app

steps.expected:
4.1.The row is mirrored in RTL: pictures are now on the right corner, and the descriptions should be on the left. The description texts should be right aligned and read right to left -except for numerals, and the the video name should not be mirrored.     
4.2.There should be a reasonable space between pictures and descriptions.     
4.3.If the videos more than one page, the scrollbar should be left-aligned.    
4.4.The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the order in which pictures are displayed

objects.name: [Music] Grids are mirrored in RTL

steps.instruction: Have your phone set in an RTL language (Arab)
Go to the Music app, with about 5~10 songs in the phone
Go to the tiles view (the initial view)

steps.expected: The grid is mirrored in RTL: ordering of songs now start from the right corner, and go in the order of right to left Nothing should overlap.  All translated texts should be right-aligned. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Rocketbar] Verify Search engine changed at Rocketbar is reflected

steps.instruction: Enable Wifi to connect to the Internet, then tap home button to back to homescreen

steps.expected: There is a list containing search suggestions provided by default search provider (e.g. Google)
steps.instruction: Tap Rocketbar and then type in some input (e.g. "bus")

steps.expected: An Action Menu prompts and displays list of available search providers (e.g. Google, Yahoo, Bing, Duck Duck Go)
steps.instruction: tap the title of "Search Suggestion" which might be "GOOGLE SEARCH"

steps.expected:
1. Back to search app. 
2. The title of "Search Suggestion" changes to a new one based on the search engine you choosed (e.g. "BING SEARCH").
3. The results of search suggestion might change to a different suggested list.
steps.instruction: change the search engine to another one (e.g. "Bing") and then tap "ok"

steps.expected: Launch browser and direct user to the search provider results. (e.g. results provided by "BING")

objects.name: [Rocketbar] Verify Search engine can be changed at Rocketbar when offline

steps.instruction: Disable network connection, then tap home button to back to homescreen

steps.expected: The title of Search suggestion is like "GOOGLE SEARCH", and there is not any result from search engine (e.g. Google) but only "No internet connection".
steps.instruction: Tap Rocketbar and then type in some input (e.g. "bus")

steps.expected: Action Menu prompts. User can change search engine even when offline.
steps.instruction: tap the title of "Search Suggestion" which is "GOOGLE SEARCH"

steps.expected: The title becomes "YAHOO SEARCH"
steps.instruction: change search engine to another one (e.g. "Yahoo") and press "ok"

steps.expected:
1. The word is selected
2. The utility bubble is  is center aligned horizontally to and above the
selected text.

steps.instruction: Scroll down the page until the first line of non-editable text is on the top of the page

steps.expected:
Because there is no space at the left side and above of the selected text and the selected text is on top. So, 
1. The utility bubble is aligned with the left side of the screen and is underneath of the selected text
2. See the 4th image of the attachment
steps.instruction: Long press the first or second character on the first line

steps.expected:
Because there is no space at the right side and above of the selected text and the selected text is on top. So, 
1. The utility bubble is aligned with the right side of the screen and is underneath of the selected text
2. See the 5th image of the attachment

steps.expected:
Because there is no space above of the selected text and the selected text is on top. So, 
1. The utility bubble is center aligned horizontally and is underneath of the selected text
2. See the 5th image of the attachment

steps.expected:

steps.expected:

Time should be right aligned but not mirrored - the digital  numbers should appear in the same order as with non-RTL locales. It  should not overlap with other UI  elements. The UI should not appear  broken in any way

objects.description:
General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r   
Prerequisites:  Have your device set to an RTL locale, such as Arabic
objects.name: [Clock] Everything under the Alarm options should display correctly in RTL

steps.expected: Text should display correctly in RTL, following the RTL  guidelines. Text should read right-to-left and should be aligned to the  right of screen. It should not overlap with other UI  elements. The UI  should not appear broken in any way

The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, the cancel button should be right-aligned and the Done button should be left-aligned. Nothing should overlap with other UI elements. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

Drop-down menus should be mirrored: The little blue carat is  on the left of each drop-down menu. The  text is now right aligned. Text reads right to left except with numerical figures. Nothing should  overlap with other UI   elements. The UI should not appear  broken in  any way
Volume indicator is mirrored: increasing sound now goes from  right to left. Nothing should  overlap with other UI   elements. The UI  should not appear  broken in  any way
steps.instruction: Observe the System alarm volume indicator

steps.expected: According to RTL guidelines, toggle button should be  mirrored: it should now be left-aligned, and the "on" position is now  activated when the blue check-mark is on the right side of the toggle  switch. Nothing should  overlap with other UI   elements. The UI should  not appear  broken in  any way

objects.description:
General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
Prerequisites:  Have your device set to an RTL locale, such as Arabic
objects.name: [Calendar] Calendar icon should display correctly in RTL

steps.expected: Calendar icon should still appear right of Month, Week, and Day views. Numerical number within icon should be unchanged. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear  broken in any way
steps.instruction: Observe the Calendar icon on bottom right of screen.

objects.description:
General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
Prerequisites:  Have your device set to an RTL locale, such as Arabic
objects.name: [Calendar] Calendar month view should be displayed correctly  in RTL

steps.expected:
2.1 The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the drawer button should be right-aligned and the add button should be left-aligned.    
2.2. First day of week at left is Saturday.    
2.3. Nothing should overlap.  
2.4.Calendar numerals ordering change to RTL.     
2.5.The date should be right-aligned with any Arabic labels reading right to left, it should successively show as weekday, month, day from right to left, and the comma should be mirrored and flipped.    
2.6.While there is no event created, the prompt text should remain center-aligned and read right to left.    
2.7.The tab buttons on bottom of screen should remain the same as that in LTR language, and with any Arabic reading right to left.     
2.8.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the Calendar month view display.

objects.description:
General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
Prerequisites:  Have your device set to an RTL locale, such as Arabic
objects.name: [Calendar] Week view should display correctly in RTL

steps.expected:
2.1.The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the drawer button should be right-aligned and the add button should be left-aligned.    
2.2.List items on week view should be mirrored: hours are now displayed on the right of screen. Numbers remain the same, however AM and PM should appear in RTL. Scroll-bar is now left-aligned and continues to move vertically.    
2.3.The date bar should be mirrored with any Arabic reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the icon with "24" should be right-aligned but not be mirrored.    
2.4.The colored line in event should be right-aligned. If the event name with long LTR texts, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of text, if the event name with long RTL texts, the ellipsis should be shown at left side of text.   
2.5.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.description:
General UX Specs: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/y60s1ngyza9jcltmpaqwfoye4f311n5r
Prerequisites:  Have your device set to an RTL locale, such as Arabic. Have multiple emails accounts on the device
objects.name: [Calendar] Drawers should have appropriate behavior in RTL

steps.expected:
2.1.The header title should be center-aligned with any Arabic reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the drawer button should be right-aligned.    
2.2.Visual tags in drawer are right-aligned.    
2.3.Words in LTR languages read left to right, but are still right-aligned. Words in RTL languages read right to left and should be right-aligned.    
2.4.Checkmark icons are now left-aligned but are not mirrored.    
2.5.Icons in the toolbar are resequenced from right to left, and the spinner icon should not be mirrored.    
2.6.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

steps.expected:
2.1 The header title and last sync information should be center-aligned and read right to left, but the number should be read left to right.  
2.2 List items will always have right-aligned text, but direction of that text depends on language. RTL languages will read right to left; LTR languages read left to right. Visual tags are right-aligned  
2.3 Time stamps are left aligned and read right to left unless there are numerals. Numerals will read left to right. Appended icons are left-aligned but not mirrored     
2.4 Icons in the toolbar and titlebar should change position, the Edit icon should be left-aligned and mirrored to reﬂect the RTL format. The Refresh icon should be right-aligned but not be mirrored and also keep move clockwise direction.

objects.name: [Email]The mail detail information view should display correctly in RTL

steps.expected:
2.1 The back button on header should be right-aligned and mirrored, the next and previous buttons on header should be left-aligned, and these texts should be center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left.   
2.2. Texts on sender,recipient, CC and BCC fields should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, but the email address should be the same as that in LTR language. If the user had written an email in LTR language, the message should be shown left aligned to match user's intent. However, if the text inputted was in RTL, the body text should be right aligned.  
2.3. The position of toolbar icon sequence should be reversed. The Reply icon and Move to icon should not be mirrore.  
2.4.If an email with a LTR subject line has an end-sentence punctuation (i.e. "This is a message!"), the end sentence punctuation for LTR strings should be placed to the right of string(Such as "This is a message!").

"Cancel" button should be shown at right, "Delete" button should be shown at left, text within buttons should be center-aligned.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

objects.name: [perftest][Gaia] Cold launch time measurement of Dialer app

steps.instruction: Use automation script, or manually tap "Phone" icon on the homescreen to launch Dialer app
Measure the cold launch. The elapsed time beginning when user taps dialer app and ending when the keypad is ready to use.
Measure the Dialer app cold launch time 10 times and calculate the average.

tags.description:
* Before you do performance test related cases, please make sure that you have set up the test data .

Steps to install reference workload

1. Clone gaia repository -> $ git clone https://github.com/mozilla-b2g/gaia.git 
2. Switch to gaia folder -> $ cd gaia
3. Install reference workload (Please make sure your device has connected to PC and Android Debug Bridge-"adb" works as expected) -> $ make reference-workload-light



* Test data (Workload - Light)

1. "200 contacts"
2. "200 sms messages"

4. "20 gallery images"
5. "20 songs"
6. 5 videos

objects.name: [Music] Share information and share icon should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Have your phone set in a RTL language (Arab)
Go to the Music app, with about 5~10 songs in the phone

steps.expected: Share icon should be left-aligned but icon is not mirrored.
steps.instruction: Tap screen to bring up the song information and rate bar

steps.expected:
6.1.Title and the texts within list items should be right-aligned.   
6.2.The icons within list items should be right-aligned and displayed at right side of texts.   
6.3.Text within Cancel button should be center-aligned but read right to left.   
6.4.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Music] Header title and search bar should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Have your phone set in a RTL language(Arab)
Go to the Music app with about 5~10 songs in the phone
Go to the titles, Playlist, Artists, Albums, Songs view

steps.expected:
4.1. Texts on header title should be center-aligned.  
4.2. If device is playing a song, there should be a play button which shown on the top "LEFT" corner, but it should NOT be mirrored.  
4.3. The "Close" button should be left-aligned but the text within close button should be center-aligned.  
4.4. Search bar should be right-aligned, the hint text in search bar should be right-aligned and read right to left  
4.5. The magnifying glass icon should be left-aligned in search bar but not mirrored.  
4.6. Inputted text is right-aligned and reads right to left unless it is in an LTR language  
4.7. The "Delete/Cancel" icon should left-aligned in search field.
steps.instruction: Observe the header title and search bar layout in these views

steps.expected:
5.1. The subheaders should be right-aligned and read right to left  
5.2. The number in parenthesis should be displayed at left side of text  
5.3. The song related information should be right-aligned and read right to left  
5.4. The album should be left-aligned but not mirrored.  
5.5. If there is no matched song in search result, the "No music found" message should be right-aligned and read right to left.  
5.6. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

4.2 Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

steps.instruction: Use automation script, or manually tap "Phone" icon on the homescreen to launch Dialer app

steps.expected:

steps.instruction: Set your phone to a RTL language (Arabic)

steps.expected: Empty song notification message is right-aligned and read right to left - except for numerals and if language is other than an RTL one. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: When there is no songs, go to the Music app

objects.name: [Messages] Messages threads list view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and have  some messages in your phone

steps.expected:
3.1 The header title remain center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, the position of the "..."  and "Edit" icon are left-aligned. The "Edit" icon is displayed at right of "..." icon.  
3.2 List items will always have right-aligned text, but direction of that text depends on language. RTL languages will read right to left; LTR languages read left to right. Visual tags are right-aligned.  
3.3 If there is portrait of contact, the portrait should be left-aligned but not mirrored.  
3.4 Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Messages] Notifications should display correctly when there is no message in phone in RTL

steps.instruction:
Precondition: There is no message in message app.   
Set your phone language to Arabic.

steps.expected:
3.1 "No messages""Start communicating now" notification should be right-aligned and read right to left  
3.2 The header title remain center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, the position of the "..."  and "Edit" icon are left-aligned. The "Edit" icon is displayed at right of "..." icon.  
3.3 Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Messages] New message view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic

steps.expected:
4.1.The header title should remain center-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left. The position of "<" and "..." icon should be swaped,  "<" icon  is right-aligned and should be mirrored, "..." is left-aligned.  
4.2."To:" in the recipient field should be right-aligned and read right to left, the “+” icon is left-aligned.   
4.3.Input the number/character in recipient field with some matched contacts are list, the contact info should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left, and the matched number/character should be highlighted, the phone number should read left to right. Contact with long LTR name, ellipsis should be displayed at right side of text, Contact with long RTL name, ellipsis should be displayed at left side of text.     
4.4.Text typed into an input area should be right-aligned and with any Arabic text reading right to left. Cursor should be right-aligned.   
4.5.The send icon should be left-aligned and mirrored, the attach icon should be right-aligned but not mirrored.     
4.6.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
The scroll bar should be left-aligned, but still move vertically.
steps.instruction: Enter enough text in the message content or add enough in the recipient field to make it scrollable.

steps.expected:
6.1 All attachments should be right-aligned in the message content.    
6.2.The texts under the attached file should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left exclusive of numerals, the name of the file should not be mirrored.
The "Sending..." should be right-aligned and read right to left, the ellipsis should be displayed at left side of the word.

objects.name: [Legacy Homescreen]App icons grid should be right-aligned in RTL

steps.expected:
1.1.For Legacy homescreen, the app grid icon sequence should be mirrored, with any Arabic labels reading right to left. Labels that are English proper nouns will remain left to right, just as that in English.  
1.2.For user homescreen customizations, app grouping and organization should be maintained.  
1.3.The collapsed icon(∨/∧) in a group should be left-aligned.   
1.4.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and observe the app grid on homescreen.

objects.name: [Legacy Homescreen]Time on lock screen should be right-aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and press power twice to enter lock screen.

steps.expected:
2.1.Time should be right-aligned in RTL. Number generally still run left to right, 24 hour format is favored.  
2.2.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the time on lock screen.

objects.name: [Legacy Homescreen]Date on lock screen should be right-aligned in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and press power twice to enter lock screen.

steps.expected:
2.1.The date on lock screen should be right-aligned in RTL. Date formatting for Arabic is day of week, numeric day of month, and name of month from right to left.     
2.2.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the date on lock screen.

objects.name: [Messages] Menu list view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and have some messages in you phone

steps.expected:
4.1 Text on cancel button should be center-aligned  
4.2 List view or title view should be right-aligned and read right to left.   
4.3 Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way

steps.instruction: Click on cancel button to return

steps.expected: See Expected of Step 4.

objects.name: [Legacy Homescreen]Unlock and camera gestures should display correctly in RTL.

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and press power twice to enter lock screen.

steps.expected:
2.1 The positions of the Unlock and Camera icons should remain the same position. The buttons should not be mirrored.  
2.2 The arrows should keep the same positions and should not be mirrored.    
2.3 Gestures and animations associated with the unlock and answer mechanism should continue to match arrow direction.    
2.4.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe unlock and camera gestures on lock screen.

objects.name: [Legacy Homescreen]Notifications on lock screen should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and press power twice to enter lock screen.

steps.expected:
2.1.The text within notifications should be right-aligned with any Arabic text reading right to left exclusive of numerals. If the notification with long LTR text, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of text, if the notification with long RTL text, the ellipsis should be shown at left side of text.     
2.2. The path of the file should be the same as the in LTR language and not be mirrored, such as screenshot.     
2.3.The icons of notifications should display at right side of the text but not be mirrored.     
2.4. Time-stamps are left-aligned and read to left exclusive of numerals.    
2.5.Tap one notification, text within "open" button should be center-aligned, and the button should be left-aligned. If the notification with long LTR text, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of text, if the notification with long RTL text, the ellipsis should be shown at left side of text.      
2.6.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Receive some notifications, such as: screenshot, calendar, message etc, and observe the view.

objects.name: [Contacts]The header title should remain the same position in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and launch Contacts.

steps.expected:
2.1.The header title should remain center-aligned, the settings and add"+" icon should be left-aligned, the add icon is displayed at right at settings icon.  
2.2.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
steps.instruction: Observe the top of the main view.

objects.name: [Contacts]The main view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and launch Contacts.

steps.expected:
2.1.Contact portrait should be left-aligned but not be mirrored, and the contact name should be right-aligned.   
2.2.Index scrolling should right-aligned.   
2.3.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.
The index icon should be the same as that in LTR language and not be mirrored.

objects.name: [Contacts]The search view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set system language as Arabic and and launch Contacts

steps.expected:
2.1.Hint texts in an input field are right-aligned and read right to left.  
2.2. Search ﬁeld contains a "search" text that it should be right-aligned.  
2.3. Inputted text is right-aligned and reads right to left unless it is in an LTR language.  
2.4. “Clear” icon and “Cancel” button are left-aligned,clear icon is displayed at right of cancel icon.

3.1. Inputted text should be right-aligned and read right to left. (BiDi only)  
3.2. The contact name should be right-aligned and the portrait should be left-aligned but not mirrored.  
3.3.The "Clear" icon should be displayed left-aligned in input field.  
3.4. Filtered results should be right-aligned and read right to left.  
3.5. Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Contacts]The new/edit contact view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and launch Contacts.

steps.expected:
3.1.Header text is center-aligned, reads right to left, and is not italicized. "Cancel" button is right-aligned, "Done" button is left-aligned.  
3.2. Hint texts in an input field are right-aligned and read right to left.  
3.3.Add portrait button should be right-aligned, label under add portrait button should be center-aligned and read right to left.     
3.4.The add icons or delete icons should be displayed at right side of the listed items.   
3.5.Value selector buttons have right-aligned text that reads right to left. The triangle icon is left-aligned and mirrored. Also note that the position of the “X” in input box  is now at left.    
3.6.Numerals typed into input fields are right-aligned but read left to right. If you enter email address, the email address should right aligned but read left to right. And inputting characters should follow LTR. If you enter a long LTR company name, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of long LTR company name.     
3.7. Text in value selector buttons should be right-aligned and reads right to left.       
3.8.The scrollbar should be left-aligned, but still move vertically.     
3.9.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Vertical Homescreen] No option is listed after all smart collections have been added

steps.instruction: Add all smart collections into Homescreen

steps.expected: action menu is launched
steps.instruction: Long tap blank space at Homescreen

steps.expected: After "Loading", verify no smart collections can be added, and a message tell user "all smart collections have been added."

objects.name: [Vertical Homescreen] All smart collections have been added and then some of them are removed from Homescreen

steps.instruction: Add all smart collections into Homescreen

steps.expected: action menu is launched
steps.instruction: Long tap blank space at Homescreen

steps.expected: After "Loading", verify no smart collections can be added, and a message tell user "all smart collections have been added."

steps.instruction: remove some of "Smart Collections" on Homescreen

steps.expected: action menu is launched
steps.instruction: Long tap blank space at Homescreen

steps.expected: After "Loading", verify the removed "Smart Collections" are listed as options.

objects.description: Prerequisite: there should be a message thread in the message app. The message should have one recipient only and has at least one message. If not, send a message to someone.
objects.name: Verify that the call button is displayed at the header of a single recipient message thread

steps.expected: A call button (phone icon) should be on the header bar.
steps.instruction: Open a message thread with only one recipient (i.e. not a group chat thread).

steps.expected: A action list should pop-up. But there should be no "call" in the list.
steps.instruction: Click the "..." button on the right side of the header bar.

steps.expected: Goes back to the message thread.
The dialer app is opened with the phone number of the message recipient.
A phone call should be made to the recipient's number.

objects.name: [Contacts]Contact details view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and launch Contacts.

steps.expected:
3.1.The header title should be center-aligned and read right to left, the edit button should be left-aligned but not be mirrored, and the back button should be right-aligned and mirrored. if any item with long LTR text, the ellipsis should be displayed at right side of the name, if any item with long RTL text, the ellipsis should be displayed at left side of the name.     
3.2.The sub-header title and text should be right-aligned and read right to left, all the icons of sub-header title should be left-aligned but not mirrored.    
3.3.If the phone number is shown with the country code, the "+" should display at left side of the phone number. And the phone number should read left to right.    
3.4.The message button should be left-aligned but not mirrored.    
3.5.Call button should be right-aligned. Phone icon should be left-aligned in call button but not mirrored. If there are two SIM inserted, SIM selection text should be displayed at left side of phone icon.  
3.6.The text or number in buttons need to move right aligned with the section title. It shouldn't have empty space on the right side.  
3.7.The link and share icon on button should be left-aligned but not mirrored.    
3.8.The scrollbar should be left-aligned, but still move vertically.      
3.9.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Messages]Conversation view should display correctly in RTL

steps.instruction: Set your phone language to Arabic and have some messages in your phone.
Launch Messages and open a conversation.

steps.expected:
3.1.The header title should center-aligned between call icon and back icon with any Arabic text reading right to left, but numerals read left to right, the back button should be right-aligned and mirrored, the phone and drawer buttons should be left-aligned and the phone button should be displayed at right side of drawer button. If the contact with long LTR name or phone number, the ellipsis should be shown at right side of text or number, if the contact with long RTL name, the ellipsis should be shown at left side of text.  
3.2.The received message should be right-aligned and the sent message should be left-aligned.     
3.3.The receive/send time and SIM info are now swapped in the message box, the "AM/PM" should be displayed at left side of the time, and numerals for time read left to right.    
3.4.Subheader labels are right-aligned and read right to left, but numerals read left to right. And the comma should mirrored flipped.     
3.5.Time-stamps are right-aligned and read to left. In the case of time stamps, numerals for time read left to right and should be consistent with locale.     
3.6.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

objects.name: [Messages]Message report view should display correctly in RTL

4.7.Nothing should overlap. The UI should not appear broken in any way.

steps.instruction: Select some contacts and tap import.

objects.description:
Prerequisite: You need at least one contact. Use make reference-workload-light from gaia to generate contacts if required. The phone under test should have a MMS-enabled SIM.

Bugzilla bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1007932
objects.name: [Messages] Can add contact as a MMS attachment

steps.instruction: Add a valid recipient with MMS-enabled data plan in the "To:" field.

steps.expected: A pop-up will show up to prompt you to select an attachment.
steps.instruction: Press the "paper clip" icon in the bottom left corner.

steps.expected: A list of contact will show up.
The recipient will receive the vcf file.
The contact should be imported. Verify that all the fields and pictures are exactly the same as in the sender's phone.
steps.instruction: Download and open the attachment on the recipient's phone

objects.description:
Prerequisite: 
You need at least one contact. Use make reference-workload-light from gaia to generate contacts if required.
The phone under test should have a MMS-enabled SIM.

Bugzilla bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1113605
objects.name: [Contacts] Can share a contact via MMS

steps.expected: The contact's detail should show up.
A pop-up should show up to prompt the user to select how to share the contact.

Goes to the "New message" screen; The message type changed to MMS, with the contact attached in this format: Firstname_Lastname.vcf; The attachment will have a randomly-generated icon and a size larger than 0 KB.

objects.description: Prerequisites: User has at least three video files already on the device.
objects.name: [Video] Verify Video app can view file information and delete video files.

steps.expected: Video File information (Name, Length, Size, Video Type, Date Taken, Resolution) are all accurate.
steps.instruction: Open the Video app and select a video to view. Tap the ellipsis (...) in the top-right corner and select 'More info'

steps.expected: User is asked to confirm that they want to delete the video. Selecting 'Delete' will remove the video from the device.
steps.instruction: Tap 'Close' to exit the info screen and return to the video. Tap the ellipsis again, and this time select 'Delete.'

steps.expected: The user is asked to confirm that they want to delete several items at once.  Selecting 'Delete' will remove the videos from the device.
steps.instruction: Return to the main video select menu and tap the box in the lower left corner of the screen.  Select two or more videos and select the Trash icon.

objects.description: Prerequisite: User has at least 2 videos on the device. One of the videos needs to be smaller than 295KB.
objects.name: [Video] Verify Video app can share videos with email and MMS.

steps.expected: User is able to send a small video file to another number via MMS.

steps.expected: User is able to send several video files to another address via E-mail.
steps.instruction: Return to the main video select menu and tap the box in the lower left corner of the screen. Select two or more videos and select the Share icon, then select 'E-Mail.'

objects.description: Prerequisites: Have the Usage app initialized with a Monthly data alert.

steps.expected: The device accurately updates to the present Date and Time.
steps.instruction: Re-enable 'Set Automatically' in the Date & Time settings.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
